intro: Merione villosa, commonly known as the hairy merione, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish or reddish in color. Merione villosa is often found in moist, sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in temperate climates.
